product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
These shorts are a good deal, fit as they should, and should last many years. I, however, am going to return mine [or give them to the Salvation Army]. I bought 1 pair of the navy and 3 pair of the black. The shorts themselves are 100% cotton as advertised--but the entire inner-waist band is a FULLY EXPOSED, expandable, non-cotton material [probably elastic]. [I have other shorts from Champion, KingSize, Casual Male in which there is an expandable (probably elastic) waist band--but they are all covered completely in the cotton material of the shorts.]

I ordered 4 pair, wore 1 pair of these shorts for a day or so, then washed them all at the same time. For the next 4 or 5 days or so, I wore these shorts almost all day everyday [just as I have with my other all-cotton shorts]--but then I discovered a terrible rash around my waist [and when you wear 2x shorts, that's a lot of waist]. I gave up wearing them, ordered from Amazon 4 pair of KingSize shorts at a similar price, and 8 or 9 days later they arrived and I have worn them since then without any rashes. They have an expandable waist band, but whatever lets them expand is covered with the same material of the shorts--COTTON.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Shorts fit fine and are constructed well, but the waistband elastic is rough and irritating on the skin. I have a different brand where they enclosed the elastic band within the fabric and they are much more comfortable.
titles: Waistband rough and irritating on skin

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I have worn Champion clothing for a long time but over the years, the word "quality" has been removed from their vocabulary- really! How can a company with their reputation market such inferior grade cotton shorts? They are very light weight thin material that would not even make a good paint rag.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I ordered these shorts from Amazon to replace an exact pair that my husband has had for years. They have the same description on the label. We were disappointed when we received them. The material is so flimsy and thin (especially compared to the originals) that he won't wear them outside the house. Champion take note.... we would gladly pay more for better grade material. Stop making and selling cheap crap online. If we had seen these in the store we would not have purchased them. I did consider Champion a trusted brand name.
titles: Cheap and flimsy material. Downgrade from the originals.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The elastic waist band is exposed and gives a scratchy feel against your skin. Refer to the photos. Everything else was fine with these shorts but that shot the comfort level down for me.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Revising my product review after wearing it for over a month. The elastic band has become very rough and makes the shorts uncomfortable to wear. I will go back to the Soffee shorts.
titles: Revising my product review after wearing it for over a ...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I ordered the navy, Oxford grey, charcoal, and black. All fit the same. I ordered a larger size (2x) than what I wear (XL) because I like walking shorts to fit loose. I also like to fold over the top. I don‚Äôt have issues with itchy skin because of the elastic band even when I don‚Äôt fold over‚Äîprobably because I purposely chose a less fitted size. I love the deep pockets. The colors have washed well (cold water), nothing unraveling or fading after approximately four washes each color. I used the dryer and noticed a slight shrinkage. Ill probably stop using the dryer to keep the material smooth and stop further shrinkage. Material is medium weight, certainly not lightweight nor heavyweight. Perfect for Miami, FL. No, I‚Äôm not a guy.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I'm always a bit reluctant to purchase clothes at Amazon, particularly pants or shorts. Not that they don't stand behind their products, but rather the hassle of buying something, not having fit, and having to go through the exchange process is just something I'd rather not do. But after my faithful pair of Hanes walking shorts finally gave up, I thought I'd give these a try. And it was the right decision. Made of 100% cotton, I was afraid they would shrink too much even in a cold washer. But that wasn't the case. The elastic waist is well-secured within the fabric as well as the tie you can use to secure and tighten the waist. While they are more of a work-out shorts, I found them very comfortable for simply walking around. The cotton fabric is lightweight but doesn't feel flimsy and the fit was exactly as advertised. I also like that the length hits just above the knee. I'm 5'9" and the length was perfect. I've put the pair through several washings and they look brand new and I'm virtually living in them with the hot weather where I am. Highly recommended.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I like to hang out in pocketed jersey gym shorts, and I also sleep in them. I‚Äôm planning to upload photos of three different pairs: (1) from a private club, these were issued to me over 15 years ago, have been worn, washed, and machine dried dozens, if not hundreds, of times, and they are still going strong; (2) from Russell ordered recently from Amazon, I found the elastic weak and ineffective, the drawstring too long and a poor substitute for good elastic, and the material more scratchy and lacking comfort, and (3) from Champion also ordered recently from Amazon, which filled the bill. Not pictured are a pair from Haynes ordered from Amazon that I would rate acceptable, although the material is a little thin compared to the Champions and my Metropolitan Club standard. I‚Äôm returning the Russell shorts and ordered three more pair of the Champions. I also bought an acceptable pair from Academy, then ordered three more pair from their website, but I returned the latter, as they were different than the store-bought (same sku), had the worst material and poorest stitching of all I tried; Academy charged about 2/3 of the purchase price for the return, so my PayPal account was credited for only about $10 against the original charge of over $30.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I have been wearing Champion shorts of this style for about 30 years. Believe it or not I get an average of 10 years before the elastic stretches or they get a hole somewhere. It was time to replace one of my current pairs in gray heather. I just received my order and noticed the weight of these is thinner than my current ones. They are also a lighter gray. Thinking back to some of the ones I bought 20 or 30 years ago I would say these are not even half as thick/heavy.

I went to the Champion website and looked at the model number and compared it to these on Amazon and it is the same.

I wish Champion (and all manufacturers) would stop trying to save a few pennies on the construction of their products and make high quality items like they used to.

I don't expect these are going to last 10 years being as thin as they are. I shall see.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
The Champion jersey shorts I bought are the cheapest, most uncomfortable, stiffest and weird shorts I've ever purchased. And as a triathlete, I've bought lots of shorts.

I love Hanes jersey pocket shorts. They are soft, comfortable, durable and wearable out-and-about, casual, to sleep in at night or do light workouts. When I stand up the Hanes shorts fall neatly into place. I bought more Hanes shorts but colors are very limited, dark gray, light gray, light green so I bought Champion jersey shorts because they came in maroon, black and dark blue.

When I bought the Champion jersey shorts and they arrived I assumed incorrectly they would soften up after the first wash/dry cycle. The tag says cotton but I promise you they feel like burlap. Champion jersey shorts are horrible. The waist band has some type of plastic all the way around that that is very uncomfortable. With the Hanes, I put them on forget I'm wearing them. The material used to make Champion shorts is so stiff and uncomfortable I always know I'm wearing them.

Here's the biggest problem of all...

Even after about a dozen wash/dry cycles, the Champion shorts remain unchanged, stiff, uncomfortable and they don't hang straight down. I just stood up to answer the door. The shorts are so stiff they retain that position and stick way out in front. It looks and feels strange. These shorts are so rigid they don't fall straight down. They stick way out, away from my legs. Good thing it was an Amazon delivery person at the door and not a friend or neighbor. I won't wear them in public and I'd be embarrassed to have a picture taken wearing them.

The last insult is, they are $3 more than Hanes!

Buy Hanes. Buy an off brand. Buy anything but Champion jersey shorts.
titles: READ THIS REVIEW BEFORE BUYING CHAMPION JERSEY SHORTS - Buy anything except Champion Jersey Shorts

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These are garbage cheap. Idk what I was expecting for 10 bucks, but these make PE shorts look like D&G swim trunks. The elastic is exposed to the waist, the material is cheap and thin, and they're not exactly comfortable. I probably won't wear them.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These are the perfect sweat shorts, unless you have a skin allergy or sensitivity. Light weight, washes and dries easily, and doesn't shrink. They also don‚Äôt stretch out over time, thereby exposing too much (which is how we feel about the Russell shorts). Plus, bonus pull string if/when the elastic doesn‚Äôt work as expected. The life of the elastic was longer than we anticipated, so that was nice (we‚Äôve purchased at least 10 of these in the last few years). We will agree with every single reviewer who mentioned the skin sensitivity. Husband has no issues. Wife often shares Husband‚Äôs shorts for PT or just post-shower on a really hot day (Wife doesn‚Äôt like her legs exposed to the public and refuses to buy her own shorts). However, Wife cannot wear these, EVER. Mere seconds after putting them on, the redness and swelling begins (contact dermatitis and latex allergy). Wife prefers the Russell shorts only because the elastic is completely encased by the same material as the shorts. On the whole though, these are better shorts.
titles: Fits as expected; agree with exposed elastic concerns

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I ordered three different brands of shorts for both my brothers: Hane's Jersey ($7), Champion Jersey ($10) and Amazon Essentials ($15). All had pockets and drawstrings.

The Hanes were the most comfortable and what they were used to. The Champions were the best looking and the ones they wear to town. The Amazon ones had the best waistband and I liked the way they looked best.

They were all good buys so it just comes down to price but they prefer the Champions. These were true to size and the boys found them comfortable.
titles: The Boys Favorite Out of Three Options

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Since I cannot get out to go shopping with this horrible Covid-12 Virus Crisis I have had to do all my shopping on line; however, on the upside I am fortunate to be able to get just about anything I need on line. I recently saw these great looking (Champion men‚Äôs grey Jersey athletic shorts with pockets and elastic waist band 3 XXL) shorts on Amazon for a fair price and decided to purchase 2 pairs of them.
I was very impressed with the quick service and was very happy with how well they fit me. These shorts are perfect for every day wear and are very comfortable.
If you are seeking a great pair of shorts which come in a variety of colors you may want to check out this product on Amazon.
Rating: 5 Stars. Joseph J. Truncale (Author: Wakizashi-Jutsu: An official Bushi Satori Ryu manual on the use of the Japanese short sword)
titles: One of the best pair of workout shorts I ever purchased.  Great and comfortable fit.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I guess like a lot of things these days, 'made in china' is the norm. These are not the Champion of the past. Material is very thin and weak. Elastic waistband is white, which you can't tell from the pictures, and it has threads or something which constantly poke at your waist until after 4 or 5 washes which eventually softens them up a bit I guess. The fit on these out of the box is uncomfortable, pockets are not very deep, and they are snug across the crotch area while loose everywhere else. Maybe they're the Champion Shorts version of skinny jeans, I don't know. I've been buying Champion 9" Jersey shorts from Amazon for years, maybe decades, but these are terrible. Might be time to switch brands. Sad.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
He For Whom These Were Purchased says they fit perfectly. I ordered the 36" waist size (Large) and they arrived swiftly and true to size. If it were me, I'd find the material a little thin because I like more support in a garment, but he likes them fine. They're sort of like gym shorts...he describes them as "medium-weight t-shirt material." They come with two side pockets, sturdy enough to hold a set of keys in one pocket and his wallet in the other. He says: "They're free-hanging pockets so they don't bulge or pull down the shorts."

There you go: a man's review of his brand new shorts. I expect we'll be return customers.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Contrary to some reviews I read, my shorts (2XL) fit perfectly and are the exact same fit as my previous, worn out Champion shorts. And contrary to some reviews I read, the weight of the cotton fabric is just perfect. I like the 9" inseam and these shorts are quite comfortable. I play tennis in the morning six days a week and I needed a second pair of shorts. These fit the need just great. The pockets are big enough to hold 2 extra tennis balls in each pocket.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought these shorts last year and again last week. The black 100% cotton is a nice cotton while the grey is 90/10 cotton poly and you can feel every polyester fiber and for that reason, I will be returning the grey pair but am additionally disappointed in the waist band being uncovered. Come on, I‚Äôd pay for for comfort so cover that waist band in the future. Also these are more 9 inch inseam. It comes below the top of my knee cap, so a long pair of shorts.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Waistband came loose after only a couple of months of use.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Bought three of these shorts for my husband to wear during physical therapy after major back surgery. All 3 started falling apart almost immediatley. After wearing them each maybe 3 times, the drawstrings pulled completely out of the waste band. No way that should have happened considering PT is pretty far from a strenuous activity. Hard to believe apparel from a brand like Champion would fall apart in less than 10 hours of use. I won't be buying these again.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Like many other reviews say, the tag on the waistband is annoying and scratchy. BUT - it is very easily remedied. The tag comes off super easy with a seam ripper and doesn't impact the integrity of the elastic waistband if you pick it off.

Overall, I didn't think I'd like these at first because the fabric seemed heavy and stiff - but after wearing them I actually do like them enough to purchase a second pair.

Champion shorts do have an annoying drawstring. It is a continuous loop that you can pull instead of a string with 2 ends that you can tie. I find myself constantly tugging the string of these to get them to stay up. You can make a loose knot in it, but not as tightly as if it were a regular string.
titles: Tag is scratchy, but easily removed.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Material was definitely not even close to what I've always come to expect when buying Champion products. These shorts were NOT the regular jersey material I've always received. Instead they were made of some thin, polyester type material that was suspiciously like the material that made up the few clothing items which I ordered from China. I'm not sure if Champion now makes a downgraded version of the shorts I've been buying for years, or maybe even if they were unauthentic. I would have returned them but I'd already thrown away packaging and it just wasn't worth the time for the cost, but I won't be ordering again in the future.
titles: Not what I thought I'd‚Äã get...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought these for comfort and the breathablity of cotton. They are good for this. What would make them great is in their ability to support a cell phone, car key fob, and a wallet without slipping off. The drawstring helps, but it isn‚Äôt very durable since it isn‚Äôt secured all the way around the waist except for a single stitch. So when you put the least stress on them, like going to the restroom, the drawstring breaks away from the back of the shorts and comes out of the shorts. A better drawstring design and securing the string at the back of shorts more securely with a locking stitch would make these 5-star worthy.
titles: Good shorts with a drawstring weakness.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I specifically searched for jersey shorts looking for some soft shorts for loungin' around now that the weather is a bit warmer. These arrived and were like sandpaper. Gave em a wash hoping they would soften up, but no. So, for either loungin' or sportin' these are a waste.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Updated review: After only 4 months the waist band has begiun to come apart on my Champion shorts. I ordered a very similar pair of shorts by Russell and they are still like new. These are very poorly made and do not hold up, sorry they are not nearly as good as i originally thought. The Russsle Athletic men's shorts are a much better deal, even when they are a few more bucks.

I got these in large and black. They fit fine. They are thinner than the Champion Athletic Shorts of 3 years ago, but then all clothes seem to be declining in quality lately. They are made in Honduras, so that is good...well better than China anyway. Price is great, especially when you consider that there are exact knock offs under the Russell brand that cost almost $2 more.
Overall I am pleased with the quality and value for the cost.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: this is not the fabric I expected... this is what you'd get when you use a tee shirt to make shorts of...most likely won't last, only certain people will wear them in public to the WAL store. They aught to have the word "Sheer" somewhere in the copy.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
We bought these shorts via Subscribe and Save and for under $8 at the time, they were a good deal. They are comfortable, have pockets, and wash up fine.

My husband is 6' tall and weighs about 240; I ordered an XL as he likes his shorts larger for comfort. They fit how he likes them to and they are comfortable.

His main gripe, as a pet owner, is that they attract pet hair more than other fabrics. If you don't have pets, you'll probably notice that they attract lint easily but for around the house, they are just fine.

They are good for the price, not high quality per say but they are worth the cost for light fabric shorts with pockets. We won't order more just because we have two short hair cats but my husband still wears them.
titles: These Shorts Attract Lint More Than We Care For

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: You get what you pay for. Put these on once and the draw string broke as I was tying them. Buyer beware. I wish I would have listened to some of the reviews before purchasing. Very cheaply made. I love champion shorts. These seem to be a knockoff. Good luck!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Bought six pairs of these shorts in different colors for my husband. They are great for warm weather and lounging around the house. They appear to be made fairly well considering they are inexpensive. The elastic around the waist does not bother him, but I can imagine that some people may be allergic. My pet peeve for all clothes today is when you wash a garment and the hem turns up which means it has not been cut along the grain of the fabric.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I really don't know how you could buy a better pair of shorts at a better price. These are great fitting, conservatively styled and priced right! Champion makes very good products. I have many and their quality is always consistently excellent. The two side pockets are deep enough to hold most anything you'd need. The drawstring is the continuous loop type, which I personally don't prefer. There are videos online that demonstrate how to tie this style of drawstring but why complicate things? I just cut the loop in the middle and tie knots in the ends to prevent fraying. All in all, why buy a knock-off brand, probably pay more and not get the quality. Give these a try.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: This is very misleading. This is glorified boxers lol. (I wear boxer briefs so you could not even imagine) I was expecting actual gym shorts. These are raw cotton that feels like canvas, and from the feel of the material you can tell it‚Äôs going to be tarnished completely after one wash. What did I expect from the price, I would recommend buying shorts from an unknown but highly rated company that can deliver a proper gym short. Very upset, and not worth my time returning I‚Äôm a busy person. So I‚Äôm stuck with three of em :(

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I tried a couple other "recommended" Amazon jersey shorts, but was disappointed with the poor elastic in the waistband. When I say poor, I mean there wasn't enough. I feared there would be a rendition of "Pants on the Ground" at any time while wearing those shorts. Luckily, Champion lives up to their name and puts strong elastic into their shorts that keeps my middle aged junk where it's suppose to be, hidden from public display. They cost a little more than other Amazon choices, but worth the extra cost that is still lower than retail stores.
titles: Finally Found Quality Jersey Workout Shorts!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Bought these for my boyfriend and he thinks they're very comfy (he's not a picky person) but in my opinion they could have been made a little better since they are a known brand. They feel a lil cheap but I guess that's what you get when you buy sporty shorts under $10. His didn't have any issues, no rips or tears and the waist band is in place so ordering these I feel is a 50/50 chance if you're lucky or not to get the messed up pair, in this situation we got lucky but we'll see when we wash them a couple of times.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I bought a medium. I am 5'6 with an athletic build @ 153lbs. I like it to be more fitted and not loose.

It hangs sightly below my knees - about 1.5-2" or so depending on how high I wear it on my waist. There's that loose fabric between your thighs.. like real loose. If you're the type that likes things to be baggy, this is for you. If you want it to be more like an athletic fit, where it is clings closer to your thighs and be at knee level or a tiny bit higher, this is not for you. Maybe it'll shrink after washing... but I should have gotten a small - maybe it would have been better.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These were a gift to an adult son who is a runner. He wears them all the time. It is obvious that he likes them a lot. The fabric is sturdy. They wash up well. They have a little bit of length in the leg, which is good, because my son is tall: 6' 2". They fit perfectly; not too tight; not too loose.
titles: He wears these all the time

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought three pair of champion authentic sweatshort for wear made in El Salvador, they are a piece of crap after couple months the thread around the waist band started coming apart after few more months the waist bands actually fell out of the shorts take measurements. I had written a review on these Shorts before but never got a knowledge by either Champion or Amazon, so I figured I'd try again to maybe stop people from buying these cheap Champion products sold by Amazon !!!maybe I can save them a couple bucks or maybe Champion Enterprises should use better thread. I'll never buy or recommend any Champion products made in El Salvador!!!!üò†üò†
titles: Don't buy Champion authentic shorts made in El Salvador waistbands Fall Apart!!!!üò†üò†üò†

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Really 4.5 stars because they aren't perfect.

I love these shorts for just kicking around the house or for going to the gym. They are comfortable, very affordable, and (from prior experience, though things may have changed) they last for quite a while. A variety of colors are available (somehow, never quite the ones I want).

You can expect the waistband to stretch out after a (long) while, and the drawstrings could be improved, but overall I'm pleased as punch with them.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Great quality and great price. These are true to size, colors are true to pictures, they are very comfortable, they re cotton so they breathe. I ordered these in a few colors and may order more. They feel really lightweight since they are cotton, but they are not lightweight, they are sturdy. I wear men‚Äôs shorts for the gym, they are much more comfortable and I like the longer length. They go right to the knee just like the picture shows, but I‚Äôm only 5‚Äô5‚Äù. They wash up nicely too

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These shorts are SO comfortable! After buying the first one and running it through its paces, I bought two more in different colors. The waistband has a good elastic that holds well without being painful, and it has a drawstring to increase the support if needed. The pockets aren't super deep, but are enough to carry keys, wallet, cell phone if needed. The fabric breathes well. Overall, an excellent product at a wonderful price!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Fine jersey shorts, but a rather ridiculous waistband. The band is just bare elastic, which I didn't think was even a "thing" anymore. It is very uncomfortable to wear against your bare skin. You will need something, like a tucked in tee shirt, to keep this from being irritating.
None of the pictures identify this. They are cheap, but not that cheap to justify the bare elastic.
Pluses, decent fabric (not mesh) and pockets. Debating on if I'm going to keep these.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I ordered these shorts as part of a new workout/lounging outfit for my husband for Father's Day. They shipped fast and actually showed up days before the estimated delivery date. They were in great shape and exactly as the described in the product summary. No rips, tears, or stains. They came packaged in plastic with the tags on them.

The only con is that they do have that packaged smell to them, but that's to be expected. Obviously, once you wash them the smell will go away. I will definitely be buying more in the future.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I have had several pair of the Champion jersey shorts for around 8-10 years. Used them for workouts, lounging around, and sometimes sleeping in. They lasted very well, but I decided to replace them this week as the seams were coming loose in spots.

I have a 34 or 35 inch waist and the medium size for the new version fits well. The new version is about an inch longer than the previous version. As others have mentioned the granite heather is 60 percent cotton and 40 percent polyester. The navy and black versions are 100 percent cotton. The granite heather version feels a bit more light weight than the shorts in the navy or black but not by much. They will most likely retain less moisture and dry a bit faster than all cotton shorts. The waist band seems about the same as the previous version, which I found to be ok. The drawstring appears to have had half of its thread count taken out. Not a problem since it still does the job but not sure if it'll hold up over a long period of time. I don't tend to use the drawstring anyway, so the point may not matter.

Can't really complain much for $7.99 a pair, but I'm rating four stars because of the apparent cost cutting measures to keep the price down. On the positive side, the shorts still have good pockets which for me has always been a must have for this type of product. This is not the kind of short I would recommend wearing out to a social event though! Running, casual biking, going to the gym are good uses if they are worn outside the house.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I've bought many of these workout shorts before. Always get "large" and they always fit just right. This last pair...a "large", is dramatically larger than previous purchases. They hang a couple of inches below my knees. And the waist/seat of the shorts is also larger. It maybe a mis-marked "X-Large". Anyway, I'll just add them to a box of giveaways to a local charity. And the next time I buy a new pair of workout shorts, I'll look for another brand.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I purchased 5 different brands of this style shorts for picky spouse. He likes every pair except this one. We sent them back. Too cheaply made with an itchy unfinished waistband that was too tight compared to all the other pairs. If you're looking for cheap trash em up shorts, these are good; otherwise keep looking.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I originally made the mistake of buying the pocket-less version, which does not explicitly state that it is pocket-less... However, these shorts are good for working out in and the pockets are reasonably sized and hold my iPhone 6 plus with no problem. The only issue is that the elastic strap is sewn directly onto the inside of the shorts, and it is pretty rough, so if it rubs against your waist, that can be uncomfortable. My briefs tend to keep this from being a problem, and I could always tuck in my shirt if the shorts band was bugging me.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I wear 34 pants and these shorts in medium fit perfectly. The tag is seen in flush, so it doesn‚Äôt itch at all. The drawstring is a loop, so it‚Äôll never get lost. The jersey fabric is like a heavyweight T-shirt. It‚Äôs light and comfy. The big drawback is the abrasive waistband. The edges are rough. I got these to lounge around the house, but they aren‚Äôt quite what I hoped for. They aren‚Äôt bad enough for me to return them, but I‚Äôm disappointed.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Have been buying this brand of shorts for years, but now it seems that was once a quality product has joined the ranks of the mediocre and disposable. The material is paper thin and feels cheap, offering little or no confidence that these shorts will last more than a few uses. Also, the elastic waist is very loose and flimsy. All-in-all, these shorts should be considered rubbish and not recommended.
titles: Used to be a quality product...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I have a couple of them and wear them regularly. The comfort is satisfying, the cotton is great, but they simply don't last for long time because coloring goes off with every wash, and because it's workout clothing- you have to wash them quite often after using them for just a couple of hours- I'm talking about dark colors like black or navy. For this reason- not recommended for gym because we don't want to appear in front of other people in visually well worn shorts. Acceptable and recommended for outdoors sports only

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I have 4 pairs of these shorts in different colors - also a pleasure to get the package in the mail. They fit right on the mark for me (at 175lbs and 6ft - I wear the large). Well made - comfortable to wear and look good to boot. Just the right length and elastic band is made for these shorts. Easy wash - no fading. Don't need to spend more unless you just want high priced brand names for 5 times as much. Just get 'em - just wear 'em - you'll like 'em.
titles: I would'nt buy anything else.  They are  just perfect ...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I ordered one of these shorts in size medium as well as one each of gray and navy. Strangely each color was priced differently although the same style number. Stranger still, this short was shipped via UPS 2-day air while the second and third colors were shipped via USPS with both packages arriving at the same time within Prime's two day promise. Imagine my surprise when I opened this box to find two aquamarine shorts, not just one. The USPS package also contained two shorts; one gray which I ordered and one black in place of navy. All these shorts were shipped from the same vender. Net result; four shorts not, and black not navy. Prices ranged from $6.00 to $12.00 and change while all appear to be the same Champion quality.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: 2x is more like a 1x. Made in Honduras (in case you didn't see it on label 5 or 6 times). The drawstring is nice but short. The waistband feels cheap but the label reminds me of a prize fighter shorts. Not washed yet, but they feel scratchy for new 100% cotton(?). I've attached a pic of label, waistband and drawstring, hope that helps ya.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The Champion shorts had a longer inseam than I thought it would. Maybe because it was a large. I believe I could have ordered a medium and it would have fit OK. I also have a hole in one of my pockets right out of the package. Since I normally only wear these when I sleep, I did not return them. I have an older pair of these shorts and they seem more substantial and the inseam was quite a bit shorter. Overall, the purchase was just okay!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I wish I had paid closer attention to the negative reviews. The fabric is flimsy and the elastic is of similar quality to very cheap men's briefs. I bought 3 pairs, we washed one pair cold and dried it on low - the waistband is not stable anymore. I have an older pair of Champions that I am ready to replace and they are in better shape than these. It is hard to believe these are really from Champion.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Do you hate the slimy feeling of other gym shorts? Do they make you swampy down you-know-where? Well then embrace the beauty of cotton shorts! These are a heavier than a standard cotton T-shirt, but have similar breathable and comfort properties. They fit great and are perfect lounging or chores.
titles: Thick cotton shorts, just like God intended

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I purchased this item and looks great on my son. I was skeptical because it is online. But it fits perfect with wiggle room. Good quality in fabric, and the Navy blue looks really nice!
We purchased size Large.
He is 5‚Äô11 height, 195lbs, medium size build

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I was a bit hesitant to order shorts online, rather than seeing them in person but they are great. I love them. I can't find any short from years past. Who stole my shorts? And these came about ten minutes after I ordered them, it seems. Great.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Wow. Had no idea these would be the same material as a tee shirt. Certainly wouldn't have paid more than $5, let alone the $12 i actually paid. I don't see these lasting more than a few wears, before they inevitably shrink or stretch in a most unflattering way. But hey, I can always sleep in my new overpriced boxers, right? I expected better from Champion, I guess next time I'll give that item description a very thorough read. I guess I thought "jersey" meant sports jersey.
titles: Well it's the same fabric as a tshirt, so...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I thought the XX-Large would be a bit too small! (I wanted an xxx or '2X') But, they fit him JUST FINE. A tall, big man- they're not too tight or too short. I love how they are all cotton- that's what we wanted. These are great.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: If you don't mind the waistband digging into your skin, these are the shorts for you. Even the label is attached with what appears to be plastic thread (?), and the stubs are great for sticking into your lower back. It's really a shame that they've overlooked this part of the construction because otherwise, they're great. But this is too big of a flaw for me to overlook. Just not comfortable at all. They're going back to Amazon. Sorry.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Like many guys, I don‚Äôt spend much time on the intricacies of clothes. These shorts fit well and the waistband is sturdy and the tie on the shorts provide a snug and comfortable grip on the waistline. They seem to keep their color through several washings. So from here I will say put your shorts on and go about your day. The only people I might not recommend these for are people who are particularly tough on their shorts, but for regular day to day use, they are awesome.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Fit well. The cotton cloth is nice. The only complaint I have is with the waistband. The last pair I purchased had the jersey material sewn over the elastic band, making it very comfortable. This cut saved the 2 inches of material and the elastic band will be right up against your skin unless you have your T-shirt tucked in or are wearing compression shorts beneath. Kind of disappointing. But I still am wearing them.
titles: 2 inches more material would have made all the difference

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I love these shorts. This is my 4th pair and they do not disappoint. Of course, I use them as pajamas. After one washing these 100% cotton shorts are soft, comfortable and breathable. Paired with a cotton t-shirt, I've been sleeping in these for years because I hate the way full-length pajamas twist and tangle in the night. Plus, living in L.A., if I have to go outside I don't look like some nut in his jammies, I just look a guy in flip-flops and shorts. I don't work out in these shorts because I am a distance runner and my workout gear is all dri-fit. Cotton for comfort, dri-fit for workout.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: When I bought these, I was dealing with a medical problem that required me to wear easy on / easy off pants. Had no shorts that did not require a belt. A belt was in the way of a medical device I was wearing. These are perfect. On and off easily, easy wash and wear, fit well. Though I no longer need the medical device, I still wear the shorts for comfort on hot days. The only negative - the pockets are a bit small and there is no back pocket. I have a large cell phone and have trouble getting it in the pockets - ditto my wallet!
titles: I was dealing with a medical problem that required me to wear easy on / easy off pants

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Used for lounging/sleeping, NOT for daily wear as gym/street wear.

They have held up well, but I have feeling if they were in a gym/street clothing rotation, and thru a wash-dry cycle a couple of times a week the waist bands wouldn't stand up to that wear and tear very long. The thread used to sew the seams, pretty light weight and again, don't think it would hold up to a lot of wash/dry cycles. The material is light weight and comfortable, doesn't lose it's shape.

They serve the purpose well for my husband uses them for, but I wouldn't purchase them for anything other than lounge wear/sleeping.
titles: Wouldn't purchase them for anything other than lounge wear/sleeping.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
It's hard for me to find sports shorts I like - I like them to be jersey, I don't like them to be too long, and I don't like excessive decoration or wild colors. So when I do find something I like I tend to by a half-dozen pairs at once. I bought two pairs of these locally 5 months ago for $14.99 a pair, after finding them by chance at Kohl's. So to get the same thing from Amazon for only $7.98 a pair...well, I just had to buy 4 more pairs!

I use them for general loungewear and as sleep shorts. They are pretty comfortable once you cut the tags out, though I do prefer that the waistband elastic be fully enclosed in jersey for additional comfort (my trusted but now ragged Jerzees brand shorts were like that), and on these it's not. So they could be even more comfortable if that were the case, but I'm not complaining.

I'm not having any of the build quality issues others have mentioned. The two original pairs from Kohl's have been in use almost constantly around the house since I purchased them (including for bed), and are holding up very well. The only compromise I'm making in looking after them is in letting them air dry from the washing machine, rather than throwing them in the dryer, but that's more so I don't run any risk of having them shrink than anything else (I don't think they would). As to the weight of the jersey material, it's not dissimilar to any other jersey knit shorts I've owned in the past.

In short (no pun intended), if you like a nice, comfortable, basic short, without looking like you're a refugee from the NBA, these should be just the ticket.
titles: Good, basic shorts, and an absolute bargain at $7.98 a pair!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: If you are looking for the "old" Champion jersey shorts with the cloth covered elastic band around the waist and that lasted forever, these are not those. These are a thinner material, sizing is off (too large for the stated size) and exposed elastic waist bands that get itchy when you start sweating. Champion took a great product and ruined it.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I read from another reviewer that these felt cheap and also the waistband would break. I don't know all the details of the other reviewer, but these shorts have a stronger waistband than your average pair of boxer shorts and I don't feel like it would break unless I wore the wrong size and stretched it out. The string on the inside to pull the shorts tight might feel flimsy, but as long as you don't treat it like a pulley, it works as intended. I don't need the string though since the waistband is enough for me.

I purchased the dark heather which have the highest percentage of polyester listed out of all the colors ( 40% polyester/60% cotton ) and they are still soft and I don't notice that blend enough to mind it. I don't think the pockets would hold keys, a wallet or cellphone comfortably, but these shorts are definitely not something I'd wear outside. They're not meant for that though, they're good for working out, sleeping and lounging around in.
titles: Great for home use - not for outdoors

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I had a dream that I wanted to start running. I had a dream that I went on a run and it was soooo magical. I woke up in a daze from my dream and ordered these shorts to help start my running career. Thanks to Amazon Prime and One Touch Ordering.... This showed up a few days later and I was surprised. I had no idea what they were or what to expect. haha. Needless to say, I love these shorts and wear them often. They're super comfortable and I really do LOVE THEM... It's been a few months... and yeah... You guessed it... I haven't started running yet. haha

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Fit on these is really weird. I ordered a medium, but the amount of material as compared to a similar pair from 10 years ago seems more like a large or extra-large. Fit in the waist is okay, but the crotch either drops several (awkward) inches below a natural position, or you have to pull the wasit-band up past your belly-button. The legs have more volume than expected. They're okay for the price (under $10) just ... weird.
titles: but the amount of material as compared to a similar pair from 10 years ago seems more like a large or extra-large

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These shorts are just what you expect and appreciate. They fit with enough room to stretch out, go for a casual bike ride and yet are not too baggy. The pockets are big enough for a set of keys and even a small wallet. And there is nothing fancy about them so they don't shine or look to be more for show than a real workout. The cotton absorbs sweat and dries quickly, not like synthetics which seem to hold moisture and become so hot they are uncomfortable. These are perfect.
titles: Good Basic Shorts with Handy Pockets

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought a pair of these several years ago, and I wore them out. These new shorts are a lighter gray, and they are very comfortable. Good for a walk around the neighborhood or just to wear in the house, but not practical for a jaunt with keys and a wallet, since they have only two front pockets. For 11 bucks, I give them five stars.
titles: Comfortable Shorts to Wear Around the House

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Bought 2 pair and wanting to get another 1 or 2, just not sure if I want to go up a size or not. The XL seemed ok prior to washing. After washing they definitely feel like they shrunk. Also wish they were a bit longer in length. Really have no issues with them otherwise. Pockets are great and I have no issue with the elastic like some have stated. Doesn't appear scratchy or anything at all to me. Would recommend, but definitely consider going up at least 1 size higher cause they will shrink.
titles: After washing they definitely feel like they shrunk

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The fit is great according to the size marked. The only issue I have is the waistband is kinda scratchy in the back where the tags are. The fabric is a bit thinner than other pairs that are the same shorts in direct colors. May have been made by other manufacturer. I would still buy them again ~ happily.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The shorts fit good, the reason for 2 stars is because based on my past experience, these champion Men's Jersey short is way tooo thin. Much thinner then the ones I have bought and currently own from the retail stores which has matching numbers. So I am surprised that although the numbers match but the quality and thickness is not there at all. I would recommend go to a retails store.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The fabric was a lot heavier than I expected, a fabric that would make for winter-weight sweat pants. Shorts are shorts, so being a heavy fabric means little in hot weather, especially because these are baggy. Champion fabric is usually heavy duty, multi-layer, and lasts a long time, I could care less whether it is fashionable. Pockets were essential and these serve their purpose, can hold wallet and keys. Comfortable padding for sitting in hot areas.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
These shorts run large. For instance, if you normally wear a large, you may want to purchase a medium.

BEWARE! The way the pockets are made your cell phone will regularly fall out when you sit in your vehicle. Most pockets have an offset at the opening near the seam to prevent just this. These shorts don't have the offset. It is just straight and my cell phone regularly falls out when I get out of my vehicle.

This, cheap material.
titles: These shorts don't cost much, but, in this case, you get what you paid for...  Not much!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: roomy. comfy. plenty of elastic. but the draw strings in these leave a little bit to be desired. but overall i have to recommend these. a good bargain. but i also must point out that i bought a black pair and they are a thinner material with NO elastic integrity. so apparently the colors matter with this brand.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Five stars; Well made, durable, unpretentious, and fit as expected. I now own 4 pair and have not one bad thing to say about this product. That said, there is a mildly annoying prick into one's lower back from the corners of the sewn-in label - - but I simply (and carefully) remove the label and all is good to go!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: So far, so good. Everything is as advertised. My only qualms about these shorts is the lifespan and I can't know that for 10 years. I purchased several similar shorts at Eskimo Joe's in Stillwater, Oklahoma at least 15 years ago and they are still being worn by me. These were made by another company. I exercise in them, I sleep in them, they are my "goto" garb when I get home. I can't believe they have lasted so long. But, EJ's works like a lot of places, they get something good then quit selling it. I would not even buy any more shorts except I can see the end of the ones purchased at EJ's. I have high hopes for these new ones. They feel great and wash up easily. Only time will tell.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These are not the shorts I had hoped for. First, they are far too small--the size I ordered fits me fine in the other brands I've bought (Russell, Jockey, etc.), but these are literally two sizes smaller then anticipated. If you need a L, order an XXL. Next, the waistband in these shorts is just bizarre. Inside the shorts, the part that touches your skin is all elastic and stitching, not smooth or comfortable at all. These dig in and rub oddly. I will not be buying these again.
titles: Much too small, and a really strange waistband design = totally uncomfortable.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Good quality sport shorts for the price. I bought a pair of these Champion Men's Jersey Shorts with pockets at the same time that I bought a pair of the Russsell Athletic Men's Pocket Shorts. I thought that I'd compare the two and order more of the one that I liked best. The Champion shorts have good quality cloth and a sturdy elastic waistband. They are constructed well. The Russell shorts felt cheap, had thin material and its elastic waistband literally starting coming apart after the first washing. I like these Champion shorts so much that I've ordered more. I wear shorts a lot (around the house and for sports) and these Champion shorts are a good value.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I use these for working shorts: paint, glue, stain, etc., are in their future. It also gets hot here and they get drenched in sweat. I have 7 pairs ('cause I hate doing laundry). For the money, very good performance. They've lasted for years. Periodically, I buy two new ones (blue and black) as "good" shorts, and try to remember which ones they are.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: First, I specifically ordered these shorts in gray because they were the only color that came in COTTON not polyester. However, when they arrived I could tell by the feel, and weight that they were most likely not cotton as advertised. Sure enough, I looked at the material tag and it had been cut out so as to not give the vendor's dishonesty away. It was bad enough that the tag was cut out to cover up the false information, but whoever cut it out cut one side too close so that is cut the seam thread. I had to have it resewn in order for it to be wearable.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: ¬†Definitely good gym shorts or lounging shorts! I do suggest washing them after you get them just to break them in a little, I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8 (173cm) and 210lbs (95 kilos) with a size 34 pants I got a medium and it fit as expected. A lot of my weight is muscle though so be cognizant of your own composition when sizing!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: They are comfortable and have pockets. I have subscribed to them monthly because my partner is a woodworker and in the heat of the summer he wears shorts in his shop. He's also very rough on clothes with staining and painting projects. These look nice when meeting customers and are sturdy.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I Purchased 4 pairs and I am very disappointed, I wish I read the reviews first. I would of never purchased. These shorts are nice but only to wear at home can't wear outside they are see though, very thin and cheaply made. Champion must of changed drastically. Will read reviews before hand, If someone said that they are cheaply made they are. I thought I was getting a deal, I was wrong you get what you paid for.
titles: I Purchased 4 pairs and I am very disappointed, I wish I read the reviews first

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Shorts so nice, I had to buy them thrice! On a serious note, I did buy three pairs and I'm not complaining. These shorts are dirt cheap in terms of price, and I wasn't looking for anything flashy or shorts I could use for the next 20 years and pass to my grand kids. I usually go to the gym for three months before I get bored and these shorts serve that purpose.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Buyer beware: the waistband is unfinished on the inside, making these shorts very uncomfortable. Worse, the tag in the back is made of nylon and the edges are like sandpaper, rubbing a raw spot in my lower back. I finally had to cut the tag out after repeated washing didn't soften it up.
Other than the waistband, these fit well and look good. They would have earned 5 stars if not for the waistband.
On the same order I purchased a similarly-priced pair of "Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Performance Baseline Short", and those have a fully finished waistband and are very comfortable. 5 stars for those.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Over the years I have ordered 4 of these. They're ok for the money but big size differences. The Large maroon is identical in size with the XL, before AND after wash/dry. Much too large for me to comfortably jog in. Black Large is fine. Don't know about other colors, probably should stick to black.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I have bought these same shorts before in size large and they fit perfectly. This time the same shorts in large are way too big. They are more like an Xxl. I don't know how that could happen unless a batch was made with incorrect size labeling. I won't buy these again because you don't know what size you are going to get and there are no free returns from this seller. Also, the quality is not as good, the waistband is very flimsy. I am noticing a reduction in quality across the board on many products lately. Have the products made overseas, reduce the quality and hope the American consumer won't notice.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: LOL, just last night there was a small string hanging off the front, I cut the string and when it receded in a hole appeared, I had not a lot of time with these particular shorts, I was on my 4th wearing I believe....oh how I remember doing things in these shorts, watching tv, sitting on the couch, taking a nap....I wonder how these would've panned out for a active person, I don't think they would've faired very well.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Thigh size is a tad wide although my husbands legs aren't thick! Great pair of shorts.
titles: Great price for a great product!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: It's medium weight so is good for the summer, spring and fall. However, Champion has done a terrible thing on the waistband. As others have noted, the elastic nylon waist band is exposed so is uncomfortable to wear. Normally, it is covered by the same cotton shorts material.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
OMGOSH they are now paper thin ! I just compared them to the same exact pair I bought last year and they are 50% thinner.
I wish they would have just increased their prices vs. selling an inferior product.
Or the seller is using a 3rd party item. Which I am starting to learn happens quite often on Amazon. Happened with a dryer I bought ... it was not an original brand item.
titles: Last time I buy champion men‚Äôs shorts

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: My only complaint about these shorts is that they are of a fairly thin cotton material. Do not know how much wear I will get out of them. Other than that they seem fine--and the price is relatively inexpensive. The thinness of the material is why I rated them only 4 stars.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: When washed according to directions they still shrunk. Some pairs are mis marked in relation to size. I.e. I ordered XL one pairs marked XL it‚Äôs obviously XXL. One pair marked XL are more like large. Plus material is itchy never happened with other champion shorts.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought these on a whim during Prime Day but I have been pleasantly surprised by how much mileage I have gotten out of these. I lounge comfortably in them while at home, have worn them to the gym once and even slept in them. Very comfortable and the fabric is light, but doesn't feel thin/cheap.
titles: Great for lounging or hitting the gym

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I was hoping I could order the same size as a similar pair of shorts from a different brand, but these are way smaller. The material is much less comfortable than I thought it would be. Yet another reminder that I should never buy clothes than I haven't tried on.
titles: Don't like the fit, don't like the material

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These shorts are not durable at all. The fabric is thin and stitching holding the elastic around the waistband comes out almost immediately. After only a month of regular wear, holes have started appearing in various places. The elastic around the waist is rough and uncomfortable. Lousy shorts all the way around.
titles: Don‚Äôt hold up at all and not comfortable

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
The drawstring of the 1st one I bought came apart (the 1st time I wore it) from the area it was stitched onto the shorts, rendering them unwearable because there was no way the elastic was going to hold the shorts on me. Then I returned that immediately and requested amazon for a return+replacement. Now after having worn it 4-5 times, the drawstring of the replaced shorts has also come apart from the exact same area as the 1st one.
I guess you get what you paid for.
titles: Not good. Drawstring keeps coming apart from the stitching

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: For my DH, he likes them and wearing them regularly. They give him good coverage, but are not as heavy as some of his other Champion shorts, and so in this heat and humidity, he is more comfortable in these shorts. They also wash well and dry quickly when hung to air dry. The pockets are good, nice and large. Glad he has these in his wardrobe!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Had my doubts but purchased anyway. Not sure if its hit or miss but my pair looks really well made. Waist band itchy, nope! All stitching looks good too. Other than that, pretty soft and would make for good workout shorts or just for lounging. Pockets are deep enough for my note 10 too.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Fits okay but I would call these more of a slim fitting short than a regular or relaxed fit. The leg seemed a bit smaller compared to other shorts I have.

Also, the elastic band is slightly abrasive if you go commando. Would not recommend.
titles: Okay but nothing to write home about...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Just lost a bunch of weight and so far am keeping it off. Waist went from 34-36 to 28-29 and these shorts are just what the doctor ordered. Comes with a stretch waistband plus a tie string if needed (I probably won't use it). Fabric is soft and comfortable. And, of course, the price was right.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: For the price, these were just what I was looking for. I'm not doing super intense work out with these. I just use them around the house to lounge in. As other's have said, the waist band is unnecessarily rough on the skin if it happens to catch you just right. Oh well. I don't need use the string because the elastic keeps them where they should be so I can't comment on it's quality.
titles: I'm not doing super intense work out with these

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
If you are good with exposed elastic waist bands these are great shorts. I prefer the elastic to be covered with cloth, so I will not purchase any more of these. I don't remember seeing it in the description. So I'm leaving this in a review where others can see it.
I'm rating it a 4 as they are good shorts, just not my preference.
titles: Nice quality short. Unfortunate exposed elastic waist band

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: these shorts are my husbands favorite ever!!they are lightweight and so comfy.i highly recommend these shorts for their material,construction,washing and drying without shrinkage and most of all their comfort!!my husband says they feel like he is not wearing anything,and he and i love them.you will,too!!(they are also a great,great value!!)
titles: MOST COMFORTABLE SHORTS! EXCELLENT QUALITY! EXCELLENT PRICE!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: For the price, these are pretty great. I think the inside of the waistband is a little scratchy, but it's to the point of being a problem. If they had a layer of fabric on the inside, I think they would be perfect. They're a lightweight sweatshirt material, almost like a t-shirt. Not as nice as an Adidas / Nike stretchy tech material, but at 1/3 the cost, I'd buy again.
titles: these are pretty great. I think the inside of the waistband ...

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I got these shorts for lounging around the house (so I wear them with no underwear) and the material is very comfortable and they look great, but the waistband on the inside is very itchy elastic against my skin. I‚Äôm sure it will get more comfortable with several washings but out of the bag it was a bit rough.
titles: Nice shorts but rough inner elastic waistband

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Fits good, very comfortable when worn.... only issue or complaint is that they show in the picture being a light grey and they are almost the same as the black that I ordered. Very slight difference in color, I would have ordered a different color so not to basically get 2 pairs of black.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I had purchased two pairs a few years back and they had a good fit and lasted a very long time. I decided to buy 3 more because I needed mediums instead of the large...I lost some weight. They are comfortable and the price was very reasonable.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: We had an issue with the fit, but it was really more a matter of taste as opposed to incorrect sizing. To me, these shorts seemed to fit my son just fine, but I could tell that he thought they were too short. The picture of the product is accurate; they fall above the knee. For teen-agers today, it might not be considered long enough. My son and his friends usually wear their shorts all the way to the knee or below the knee. We ordered a size medium and they fit fine in the waist. They were not long enough for my son's tastes, but to be fair, he is 6"2. We'll use them as a good around-the-house pair of shorts for a hot, summer day.
titles: Good Around-the-House Shorts for my Teen

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I wear a medium everything except these shorts. I bought a pair of mediums and they were way too big from the get go. I then ordered a pair of smalls and it was a perfect fit. I have a 33" waist. Otherwise this is a good product and comfortable

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: My son lives in these. I'm not joking, I just purchased 6 pairs (again). He's 6'2" tall but wears the small because his waist is 29 inches. They fit perfectly in the length and are comfortable. I wash them constantly and only after about 6 months of almost daily wash do they start to fade in color. He can play sports and dance in these shorts, so they're not restrictive at all. Reliable and durable.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: My husband is 6'0" and he loves it. He likes that it can keep him cool. The material is lightweight, thin and doesn't drag like your typical basketball style mesh shorts. Very comfortable and perfect for doing anything while wearing them. Color is a nice heather grey. Also comes with pockets obvi!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Have been using this champion shorts for many years now. I bought four pairs two years ago. Everything as expected. This year two more pairs. NEW and IMPROVED by their standards. Noticeably thinner material. Do not love them anymore. Still like them though.
titles: Thinner material but still like them.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I like Champion products don‚Äôt get me wrong, but this is not a good product. The waistband is super irritating. Mine even came with a nice discolored tear in them fresh out of the packaging. These are just cheaply made so don‚Äôt expect much.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Really good fit. Comfortable material, good elastic in the waistband, nice roomy pockets.
I wear these while I'm walking on an elliptical machine, on the track, playing basketball, and lifting weights...and they are great. I can keep my locker keys in the pocket without worrying about them falling out and getting lost, tripped over, or stuck in a machine.
The fit is just as expected based on the size chart. They're loose enough to stay comfortable even after walking 2+ miles on a treadmill but snug enough that I don't have to worry about they weight of my keys and stuff pulling them down in the middle of a workout.
titles: Good fit. Comfortable. Very good for walking, running, playing basketball, or lifting weights.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: First of all these shorts get a high rating for mostly the price alone because these are so affordable but you get the classic Champion brand. I will say although these shorts are not the highest quality in terms of the material not being that soft, or it does feel a little bit rough I think these shorts are pretty good and fit well a little larger than expected. I was mostly going to use these for being around the house or going to my college classes, but I think you could wear these anywhere they look fine.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I am a very curvy gal. Usually men's shorts don't accommodate wide hips, but these fit very comfortably and they keep me cool. I wear them all day long and they never creep up my inner thighs. They stay where they should. I love them!

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The fit and quality for the shorts are fine, but there is an enormous Champion tag sewn into the back that scratches your skin. It is so tightly sewn that you cannot cut it out without damaging the waistband. A softer cloth or a tag in another location would have worked. I have had to stop wearing the shorts unless I have a tuck-in t-shirt.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought these shorts for my boyfriend and when they came in the mail I thought they were going to be too big. He is 5'9 and weighs about 220 pounds. He fits a large but normally likes his clothes a little bigger so I bought an xlarge. It fit perfectly!! The material feels like sweatpants and he told me they are very comfortable to wear. He loves it and if he's happy then I'm happy!
titles: I thought it was going to be too big

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: these are very comfortable and cool to run in. i ordered what i knew would be a slightly larger size on me, just so they wouldn't be so restrictive to run in.
titles: these are very comfortable and cool to run in

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I wear these shorts to bed instead of boxers. I used to have a couple pairs of the Russell brand of knit shorts similar to these. However, as mentioned in a previous review I read, the waistband is NOT sewn into the knit material (unlike the Russell shorts). And to me that is fine. Yes the drawstring is not a loop, but attached to the rear seam of the waitband. Ok...I wanted a bargain...I got bargain craftsmanship. Also, the tag does read 100% cotton. I first bought a pair at a chain sporting goods store that seems to be the "authority" on this matter. I checked the tag on it and the item number is the same as listed here in Amazon (Item model number: 85653) So I decided to order more from Amazon. When my order arrived, they were identical to the shorts purchased from the store.
titles: Champion it is.  Loved my Russell jersey shorts with pockets though.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Old guy here, and I have worn this particular style short for many years. They are now lighter in weight, and although they appear very well constructed as I am accustomed to, these X-Large are smaller than the several pairs of old, very well-worn size Large ones I already owned. It's not easy to find shorts like these. I like the cotton, inner drawstring, reinforced non-roll waistband, and two pockets, so I intend to order more, but am disappointed in the sizing.
titles: It's not easy to find shorts like these

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I used these shorts pretty hard at the gym. They are nice because they have a pocket for my phone and are 100% cotton. They just don't wear that well.....I'm already having to buy more since they are getting holes. Yes, it's worth it to keep buying again but just not 5 stars worthy.
titles: They are great gym shorts but fall apart/get holes after 6 months

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: For wat i paid for these shorts i thought well they willb b ok. For around the house ... no sir ive wore them out every where ... wow they fit so good .. they look really good .. yeah u can bet im ordering more of these... thk u. God bless

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I have purchased this many times for my dad in the different colors. The material is cotton and comfortable for daily wear. holds up against frequent wash cycles as well. Price is also perfect.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
Nice shorts for all year round in the house... a little thin for my taste I was hoping for something like the cotton gym shorts we used to wear. but these are nice. would give it 5 stars but not entirely fond of the waist band. It's sewed inside as opposed to being sewed inside a folded over piece of cotton. so the elastic some times catches hairs when I take them off.

I got the xx-large fits 44 - 46 waist

follow-up feedback - I purchased these again. over all great shorts with a lousy waist band.
Ordered the purple ones this time as the picture looks great. Just a side note... they are aztec blue and not purple

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Very poor quality. Following the first wear the threads in the waistband broke in multiple places resulting in the threads completely coming out and the uncomfortable rubber waistband came loose. Useless after one use.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Great product at great price. Delivered quicker than expected. Well made

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Bought XL. Comfortable lose fit. I'm 5'8", I didn't care for the legs being half way through my knees. It is a personal preference, but I like the length to be either above or below my knees. I found the label inside the back of the shorts to be very irritating and pokey. It is made of a stiff material and can be sharp and pointy poking my back. Would have been better if they used a softer material for the label.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The elastic waist band is very rough and cuts into your skin with its sharp edges. For a few cents more, Champion could have enclosed elastic band in cotton, like all of my other shorts, but instead, they cheaped out. The cotton material is also thin. On the plus side they have pockets, and aren't too long. Those pros are overcome by the uncomfortable elastic band digging into your waist. Returning for refund.
titles: Avoid! Cheap, Exposed Elastic waistband is Uncomfortable

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: My son says these are very comfy. They will be worn to school but they seem to be more of a relazed gym or lounging looking short. The color is similar to a medium to dark grey. Elastic band helps give extra stretch when needed. Area around legs is pretty baggy. These are not as long as some kids prefer these days but work well for shorter kids/men to give that lengthier look. Good price. Material is soft...no fraying. Champion shorts.
titles: Very comfy shorts at good price.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
I don't need expensive clothes to workout with at the gym, like a lot of those weirdos. I'm happy as long as there's pockets.

Its just a nice cotton pair of shorts. There's no fancy sweat wicking crap.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: The waistband on these is like a serrated knife. It has teeth like a plastic zipper that shred your skin. It's a shame too, because I love the material, the color, and the fit. But I can't wear them... returning.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: I bought several pair of these because I was going to be in hot weather for the summer and needed some pockets. the tags stick right into the center of your back. the fabric is scratchy and I was uncomfortable the entire trip. please consider softer cotton, and a tagless approach. thank you.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Black basketball shorts are a staple of my husband's wardrobe outside of work. He doesn't love the fabric of these, but he's partial to mesh and these are jersey, so take it for what it's worth. They wash OK, but have faded a bit. Though, again, they are black fabric. So overall: they're OK for gym shorts.
titles: They are OK for gym shorts

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents:
As in other reviews, please note elastic is exposed inside the waist of these shorts. Some may find this irritating on their skin and I would not recommend these shorts to those with skin sensitivities.
Excellent value and otherwise, fit is good. Nice and roomy. I purchased a medium and I measure 34" around my waist.
titles: Elastic is exposed inside the waist of these shorts

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Not crazy about these. Cloth is rough and they're much too long on a 6 foot tall man. They come to his knees. And the waistband is scratchy and uncomfortable. Not the quality I've come to expect from Champion.

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: These shorts are great for the hot, humid dog days of summer. Very comfortable 100% cotton, with an elastic waist, + pockets! Cannot beat the price & excellent service on Amazon! Now own 1/2 dozen pair, with different colors - use to hang around the house, but are OK for a quick trip to the store. Highly recommend! BigBill
titles: These shorts are great for the hot

product_name: Champion Men's Jersey Short With Pockets
review_contents: Real quick: I've purchased several of these over the years. But the material in these latest shorts has gotten way thinner. Any thinner and they would be considered to be "sheer."
